page.title: 02Recreation and Tourism
page.content: In the heart of Middleton village is a small croft donated by the Waterhouse estate and converted into a children's playground with a tarmacadam surface for the two swings and the war memorial lawn. A committee arranges fund raising functions including talks of local interest, band concerts, whist drives, discos. Two residents have an excellent collection of vintage cars. These provide considerable interest and are frequently seen around the village. The High Peak Hunt meets in the village twice a year, providing a colourful and lively occasion. Visitors and tourists come from far and wide to enjoy the features and qualities described in this survey. Special provision includes two picnic sites, waymarked footpaths and cycle routes and scenic routes for cars.
